summary: The ecosystem concept, originally from biology, is metaphorically applied in varied fields like cryptocurrency to suggest less hierarchical, more cohesive organizations. Unlike biological ecosystems, modern ones transcend space and time via the internet and demand open-ended design for productivity. The listed resources include an article discussing the flexible application of ecosystem architecture in crypto and a course guiding on how to develop a thriving ecosystem through leadership, adaptability, creativity, and aesthetics.
excerpt: Ecosystems, once tied to biology, are now metaphorically overused in fields like crypto, indicating a desire for less hierarchical organizations. Modern ecosystems transcend space and time, needing careful, open-ended design.
